text: Amandine Brossier (born 15 August 1995 in Cholet) is a French sprinter specialising in the 400 metres. She won a bronze medal at the 2019 Summer Universiade. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|2017 |rowspan=2|European U23 Championships |rowspan=2|Bydgoszcz, Poland |14th (sf) |200 m |23.91 |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |4 × 400 m relay |44.06 |- |rowspan=2|2018 |Mediterranean Games |Tarragona, Spain |bgcolor=silver|2nd |4 × 400 m relay |3:29.76 |- |World Cup |London, United Kingdom |5th |4 × 100 m relay |43.34 |- |rowspan=6|2019 |rowspan=2|European Indoor Championships |rowspan=2|Birmingham, United Kingdom |17th (sf) |400 m |54.56 |- |4th |4 × 400 m relay |3:32.12 |- |World Relays |Yokohama, Japan |8th |4 × 400 m relay |3:36.28 |- |Universiade |Naples, Italy |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |400 m |51.77 |- |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Doha, Qatar |41st (h) |400 m |52.81 |- |12th (h) |4 × 400 m relay |3:29.66 |} ==Personal bests== Outdoor *200 metres – 23.33 (+2.0 m/s, Albi 2018) *400 metres – 51.77 (Naples 2019) Indoor *200 metres – 23.44 (Liévin 2018) *400 metres – 52.77 (Miramas 2019) ==References== Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:French female sprinters Category:People from Cholet Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in athletics Category:Universiade bronze medalists for France Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Medalists at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Amandine Brossier
